javadoc.text:
*
Common matrix operations for fixed sized matrices which are 4 x 4 or 4 element vectors. *
DO NOT MODIFY. Automatically generated code created by GenerateFixedOps
javadoc.author: Peter Abeles

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the following operation:
*
* c = a + b
* cij = aij + bij
* *
* Matrix C can be the same instance as Matrix A and/or B. *
javadoc.param: a A Matrix. Not modified.
b A Matrix. Not modified.
c A Matrix where the results are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the following operation:
*
* a = a + b
* aij = aij + bij
*
javadoc.param: a A Matrix. Modified.
b A Matrix. Not modified.

javadoc.text: * Performs an in-place transpose. This algorithm is only efficient for square * matrices.
javadoc.param: m The matrix that is to be transposed. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Transposes matrix 'a' and stores the results in 'b':
*
* bij = aji
* where 'b' is the transpose of 'a'. *
javadoc.param: input The original matrix. Not modified.
output Where the transpose is stored. If null a new matrix is created. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the following operation:
*
* c = a * b
*
* cij = ∑k=1:n { aik * bkj} *
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
b The right matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
c Where the results of the operation are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the following operation:
*
* c = aT * b
*
* cij = ∑k=1:n { aki * bkj} *
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
b The right matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
c Where the results of the operation are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Performs the following operation:
*
* c = aT * bT
* cij = ∑k=1:n { aki * bjk} *
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
b The right matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
c Where the results of the operation are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Performs the following operation:
*
* c = a * bT
* cij = ∑k=1:n { aik * bjk} *
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
b The right matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
c Where the results of the operation are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs matrix to vector multiplication:
*
* c = a * b
*
* ci = ∑k=1:n { aik * bk} *
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
b The right vector in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
c Where the results of the operation are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs vector to matrix multiplication:
*
* c = a * b
*
* cj = ∑k=1:n { bk * akj } *
javadoc.param: a The left vector in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
b The right matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
c Where the results of the operation are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the vector dot product:
*
* c = a * b
*
* c> = ∑k=1:n { bk * ak } *
javadoc.param: a The left vector in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
b The right matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.

javadoc.text: * Sets all the diagonal elements equal to one and everything else equal to zero. * If this is a square matrix then it will be an identity matrix.
javadoc.param: a A matrix.

javadoc.text: * Inverts matrix 'a' using minor matrices and stores the results in 'inv'. Scaling is applied to improve * stability against overflow and underflow. * WARNING: Potentially less stable than using LU decomposition.
javadoc.param: a Input matrix. Not modified.
inv Inverted output matrix. Modified.
javadoc.return: true if it was successful or false if it failed. Not always reliable.

javadoc.text:
* Computes the determinant using minor matrices. *
* WARNING: Potentially less stable than using LU decomposition.
javadoc.param: mat Input matrix. Not modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* This computes the trace of the matrix:
*
* trace = ∑i=1:n { aii } * *
* The trace is only defined for square matrices. *
javadoc.param: a A square matrix. Not modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Extracts all diagonal elements from 'input' and places them inside the 'out' vector. Elements * are in sequential order. *
javadoc.param: input Matrix. Not modified.
out Vector containing diagonal elements. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Returns the value of the element in the matrix that has the largest value.
*
* Max{ aij } for all i and j
*
javadoc.param: a A matrix. Not modified.
javadoc.return: The max element value of the matrix.

javadoc.text:
*
* Returns the absolute value of the element in the matrix that has the largest absolute value.
*
* Max{ |aij| } for all i and j
*
javadoc.param: a A matrix. Not modified.
javadoc.return: The max abs element value of the matrix.

javadoc.text:
*
* Returns the value of the element in the matrix that has the minimum value.
*
* Min{ aij } for all i and j
*
javadoc.param: a A matrix. Not modified.
javadoc.return: The value of element in the matrix with the minimum value.

javadoc.text:
*
* Returns the absolute value of the element in the matrix that has the smallest absolute value.
*
* Min{ |aij| } for all i and j
*
javadoc.param: a A matrix. Not modified.
javadoc.return: The max element value of the matrix.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the an element by element multiplication operation:
*
* aij = aij * bij
*
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the multiplication operation. Modified.
b The right matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the an element by element multiplication operation:
*
* cij = aij * bij
*
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
b The right matrix in the multiplication operation. Not modified.
c Where the results of the operation are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the an element by element division operation:
*
* aij = aij / bij
*
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the division operation. Modified.
b The right matrix in the division operation. Not modified.

javadoc.text:
*
Performs the an element by element division operation:
*
* cij = aij / bij
*
javadoc.param: a The left matrix in the division operation. Not modified.
b The right matrix in the division operation. Not modified.
c Where the results of the operation are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Performs an in-place element by element scalar multiplication.
*
* aij = α*aij *
javadoc.param: a The matrix that is to be scaled. Modified.
alpha the amount each element is multiplied by.

javadoc.text:
*
* Performs an element by element scalar multiplication.
*
* bij = α*aij *
javadoc.param: alpha the amount each element is multiplied by.
a The matrix that is to be scaled. Not modified.
b Where the scaled matrix is stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Performs an in-place element by element scalar division.
*
* aij = aij/α *
javadoc.param: a The matrix whose elements are to be divided. Modified.
alpha the amount each element is divided by.

javadoc.text:
*
* Performs an element by element scalar division.
*
* bij = *aij /α *
javadoc.param: alpha the amount each element is divided by.
a The matrix whose elements are to be divided. Not modified.
b Where the results are stored. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Changes the sign of every element in the matrix.
*
* aij = -aij *
javadoc.param: a A matrix. Modified.

javadoc.text:
*
* Sets every element in the matrix to the specified value.
*
* aij = value *
javadoc.param: a A matrix whose elements are about to be set. Modified.
v The value each element will have.
